c74object.name: cage.spacer
c74object.description: cage.spacer allows inserting time in a roll. Note tails falling into one of such zones can be either prolonged or splitted according to the split attribute.

inlet.digest: Roll into which silence must be inserted
Positions and durations of the insertions.
inlet.description: An llll received in the second inlet must be composed of one or more sublists, each containing a couple of values indicating the starting time and duration in ms of a portion of silence. Alternatively, the llll can be composed of a single couple of starting time and duration.

objarg.name: insertions
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the initial insertion parameters, expressed as an llll whose sublists contain a couple of values indicating the starting time and duration in ms of a portion of silence. Alternatively, the llll can be composed of a single couple of starting time and duration.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the roll obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description:
cage.spacer expects a roll in the first inlet, into which one or more portions of silence will be inserted according to the llll received in the second inlet. The result of the insertions will then be output as a roll.
An llll received in the second inlet must be composed of one or more sublists, each containing a couple of values indicating the starting time and duration in ms of a portion of silence. Alternatively, the llll can be composed of a single couple of starting time and duration.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: split
attribute.description:
When the split attribute is set to 0 (default), all the notes of the original rolls are left untouched.
When it is set to 1, the notes whose tails are cut by the split point are themselves split, with silence inserted.
When it is set to 2, the durations of the cut notes are augmented of the duration of the silence.
When it is set to 3, the cut notes are trimmed at the insertion point.
When it is set to 4, the cut notes are trimmed at the split point.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (roll)
entry.description: Roll into which silence must be inserted.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Positions and durations of the insertions.. An llll received in the second inlet must be composed of one or more sublists, each containing a couple of values indicating the starting time and duration in ms of a portion of silence. Alternatively, the llll can be composed of a single couple of starting time and duration.
